intro: Diplophyllum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy diplophyllum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
